reviews.text: This was a wonderful place to sit back and enjoy the view----we spent two nights and loved everything--they lit a bonfire for us---and were so helpful---they suites/cabins are spotless and beautiful--very clean with everything you need. We saw a few other guests, but had a great deal of privacy. We cooked out one night--had steak-who knew you can't buy fresh halibut on the spit....
reviews.title: We wanted to stay longer....

reviews.stay_parameters: Stayed July 2007, traveled as a couple
reviews.text: We did spend an additional night in Homer at Two Sister's because there we couldn't get another night at Alaska Suites. We had a different experience being in the Old Town within walking distance to the beach. Highly recommend both.
reviews.title: Fabulous Views/Great Cabins

likes.liked: — The separate cabins with no common walls

reviews.text: Stayed at Alaskan Suites for 5 nights after reading all the reviews on Trip Advisor. The property was very clean, well maintained and they could not have been anymore helpful. The room amenities were actually very useful and I could have easily stated longer. The views from the deck were incredible. I honestly could not find a fault with this property. Will be returning to stay again in 2007.
reviews.title: great cabin, great views, great people

likes.liked: — The cabin was warm, inviting, great view, and wonderful people

reviews.stay_parameters: Stayed May 2007, traveled as a couple
reviews.text: What a gret place to begin our Alaska journey. After reading all the reviews on TA I was confident that this was the place for us. The Alaskan Suites totally met my expectations and more. The cabins are warm and inviting, they have two comfy beds, a nicely stocked kitchen, and a nice big bathroom. I can go on and on about the all the x-tras they have--nice plasma tv, BBQ, a leather couch, but none of that compares to the warm and inviting owner and staff. We arrived a little on the late side, but they were waiting for us (they told us our cabin ahead of time and said it would be open just in case our flight was delayed) and quickly checked us in. Both Jon (the owner) and Dave were very friendly from the start. Our second night there, we saw both men by the bonfire and decided to head down and hear some stories. What a great night. I walked away feeling like we had known them our whole lives. It's nice to meet people who are so excited about their home that they want to share it with you as well. After our long night, I walked away feeling like this was a place I would like to call home as well.
reviews.title: Grade--A Plus

reviews.stay_parameters: Stayed June 2007, traveled as a couple
reviews.text: We were lucky enough to have picture perfect weather, and we were able to see the "million dollar " view. everyday. It truely is breathtaking. I don't know which was better, the views, or the bald eagles swooping over our heads.
reviews.title: Best that Homer has to offer

reviews.text: The view from the back porch of your Alaskan Suite cabin truly is remarkable, and one of the best in town with mountains, glaciers, the sound, and a smoking volcano. Bald eagles regularly soar right in front of you. The Suites are nicely decorated, and the owners continue to invest to improve them, as evidenced by the new plasma screen TVs, back porch gas grills, internet phone service, and Denon stereo system. The outdoor hot tub was huge, although the water quality and the massage jets weren’t the best. The two things which you should be aware of are: a) the 5 cabins are placed very close to each other (only a few yards apart), so you won’t have much privacy on your back porch; and b) the cabins are only a few dozen yards away from the main highway leading into Homer, so there is a lot of traffic noise during most of the day. Still, we would recommend this place.
reviews.title: Great Cabin with Unparalleled Views

reviews.text: My family of four ( including two teens) stayed here a few nights the end of July 06.
reviews.title: Absolutely the best!!!!!!!!!!!!!!!!!

reviews.text: I could not find a thing wrong with this property.....42 inch plasma tv, refrig, microwave, plates cups and utensils for eating in and grilling outside on the deck. Double beds with a pull-out sleeper sofa! Everything in these cabins is thoughtfully placed and the owners couldnt be more helpful with any questions you have!Expansive views from the deck...just breathtaking!
reviews.title: Incredible

reviews.text: We even had a s'mores roast at the fire pit! There are currently 5 cabins...the owners' son in law said they are planning to build 5 more in the future..not sure when. And, for all you tired travelers, there is a wonderful hot tub that seats 10-15 folks. We watched the eagles soar above the water bay while we soaked in the hot tub....just awesome!
reviews.title: The best!

reviews.stay_parameters: Stayed July 2006, traveled as a couple
reviews.text: We went horseback riding at Trails End Adventures..Mark is a GREAT guy! And dont forget to walk the spit too!
reviews.title: Top Notch Cabin
Awesome
reviews.text: This is a great place to stay. The views out our room are beautiful!! There is a large hot tub outside if we wanted to view the scenery from there, and they light a large fire pit they light in the evening. They have s'mores kits too. There are many amenities and thoughtful touches - oatmeal, cocoa, popcorn in the room, if you don't want the view, there is a large screen tv complete with surround sound and many DVD's available. The cabin is very comfortable. There is a guestbook in the cabin and many people have raved about their stay - some have extended theirs or said they would definitely return. It's close to town. They recommended eating at the Sourdough Cafe on the way in to town. What a good meal that was - be careful though, there are some incredible baked goods to tempt.

reviews.title: Awesome views
reviews.text: November in Homer was perfect. It was nine degrees outside and clear. The Loon Cabin was perfect. Every amenity you could think of and lots of help at the front desk. The views were amazing with that cold crisp air. Great base and Homer has some of the best resteraunts in Alaska.

My husband and I stayed here for one night while in Homer in August 2005. We absolutely LOVED this place! We had our own little cabin, complete with fantastic views, lots of space, high ceilings, and rustic, comfortable decor. The bed was extremely comfortable. We loved the little porch off of the back of the cabin which faced Resurrection Bay. Had the weather been warmer, I'm sure we would've sat outside.
reviews.title: Charming cabin, one of the nicest places we've ever stayed!!
One of the best places I've ever stayed
reviews.text: There is no cooking allowed in the cabin itself, but dishes, utensils, pots, and pans are provided and there is a gas grill on the back porch. There is also a microwave, sink, and small refrigerator in the room.

reviews.title: Time of my life
reviews.text: The location is on a bluff which is not far from the highway, which may be its only drawback for those who are light sleepers, but the incredible views and wonderful rooms certainly make up for it!! We would definitely stay here again!!

reviews.stay_parameters: Stayed September 2007, traveled as a couple
reviews.text: We stayed three nights in the Red Salmon cabin and were delighted with the accommodations. We appreciated the fully outfitted kitchen, comfy beds, decor, recliner, large-screen TV and spaciousness. Location is excellent, with easy drives into Homer and places of interest, including the Homestead Trail for great hiking. View of Katchemak Bay from the back porches is delightful. Owners were helpful and pleasant.
reviews.title: Relaxing and well equipped cabins

reviews.stay_parameters: Stayed October 2007, traveled as a couple
reviews.text: These cabins were the highlight of our recent trip to Alaska. We were very impressed with the cabin, but, were awestruck when we opened the rear door to the porch and saw the view. Spectacular. They claim it's a million dollar view but they are wrong...this is a billion dollar view and all right from your quaint and cozy little cabin. The cabin is stocked with full amenities. All you have to do is bring your food, clothes and toothbrush! Hot tub was out of this world, and the late night bon-fire was too much fun. Highly recommend more than one night...wish we could have stayed longer. Was a little concerned about the roadway noise, but you soon forget all about that. It gets very quiet after dark. The only thing lacking would be a fireplace. I would never leave!!! Excellent value. Will hopefully get to stay there again, and would only go back to Homer to stay at these cabins, as there isn't anything else to do in Homer. Just kick back and watch the sunrise and sunset.
reviews.title: Awesome place to stay

reviews.stay_parameters: Stayed September 2007, traveled as a couple
reviews.text: The cabin was fantastic. I was a little worried because most of the reviews sounded like the owners might have written them, but everything anyone said was true. My wife and I have travelled all over the world, and this was our favorite place we've ever stayed. Plasma TV with surround sound was awesome. Wireless internet was also
reviews.title: All the amenities of home

reviews.stay_parameters: Stayed September 2007, traveled as a couple
reviews.text: available. It was a little expensive for 2 people, but it was worth it - there are definately other options in Homer that are the same price and wouldn't be anywhere close to as nice. Only about 5 minutes
reviews.title: Highlight of the trip

reviews.text: from town. Went kayaking with True North, and had a great trip. Don't
reviews.title: Our Favorite Place to Stay during our Alaskan Trip

likes.liked: — The Cabin itself, the incredible VIEW, the grill, the TV
likes.disliked: — Need to be careful approaching the property when coming from Homer. A bit of a blind driveway with fast approaching traffic
